definition: broaden, expand one's horizons

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
boundary/scope/extent/circles/group/kingdom (taxonomy)

sentences.english: She had an eye-opening experience that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她可是开眼界了。

sentences.english: eye-opening experiences compared to the atmosphere of the other institution.
sentences.chinese: 与其他大学比起来，这里的氛围使人大开眼界。

sentences.english: And, especially for teenage girls, very eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 而且，特别是对年轻女孩，很开眼界。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大开眼界，拍手叫绝。

sentences.english: This was truly an eye-opening session.
sentences.chinese: 这是真正令人大开眼界的会议。

sentences.english: Listening to him talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 听他谈在中国的历险令人大开眼界。
这次经历让我大开眼界。

sentences.english: What an eye-opener it's been for me!

sentences.chinese: 开眼界并且我非常谦卑。

sentences.english: But for some scholars, the Magdala Stone was the real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 但是在一些学者看来，抹大拉石头是真正的大开眼界。

sentences.english: Readers will find the answers eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 读者会找到答案开眼界。

sentences.english: My eyes were opened when I visited this year's Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 今年的温布尔登之行使我重开眼界。

sentences.english: To defense lawyers, the new research is eye opening.
sentences.chinese: 对于辩护律师来说，这项新研究是很让人大开眼界的。

sentences.english: Overall, it was a very eye-opening experience.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，这是一个非常开眼界的经验。

sentences.english: Listening to aim talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener .
sentences.chinese: 听他谈在中国的历险令人大开眼界。

sentences.english: My trip to Shenzhen was quite an eye - opener .
sentences.chinese: 我的深圳之行真令我大开眼界。

definition: to gain knowledge and experience
to see the world/to broaden one's horizons
the wider world/diverse aspects of society
ken/scope
to gain first-hand knowledge of sth/to experience for oneself/knowledge/experience/insight
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
knowledge and experience
to travel extensively
a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing
pinyin: bai3 wen2 bu4 ru2 yi1 jian4

definition: the first time/for the first time
nothing is too bizarre/full of extraordinary things
country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
for the first time/on the previous occasion/last time (something occurred)
experienced and knowledgeable (idiom)
to blush with shame (literary)
